title: Relative strengths of acids-bases given small K

content.question:
ClO2-(aq) + HCOOH(aq) ⇄ HClO2(aq) + HCOO-(aq)             Keq < 1

What are the relative strengths of the acids and bases in the reaction represented by the equation above?

choices.label:
Acid Strength
    Base Strength   

HClO2 < HCOOH
 ClO2- < HCOO-

Acid Strength
    Base Strength   

HClO2 < HCOOH
 ClO2- > HCOO-

Acid Strength
    Base Strength   

HClO2 > HCOOH
 ClO2- > HCOO-

Acid Strength
    Base Strength   

HClO2 > HCOOH
 ClO2- < HCOO-

content.answer:
Acid Strength
    Base Strength   

HClO2 > HCOOH
 ClO2- < HCOO-

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
